sub_title: MSc in Energy and Process Technology (TU Delft) | 3 years of experience managing 133 wind turbines | 1 year in developing technologies for energy storage with alternative fuels using CCU.
summary:
First and foremost, I am an enthusiast for sustainability and passionate about companies that are trying to make a difference in the global energy transition. I am obsessed with the idea that apart from inventing clean technologies for energy production and storage, it is also imperative that the current industrial processes become more efficient and productive. And the onus to do so, rests not just on the shoulders of a few, but everyone who is capable enough to recognize the problems that mankind faces. This is put beautifully in the statement of Robert Swan “ The greatest threat to this planet is the belief that someone else will save it”.

For my first professional contract, I chose to work with WWIL where I kick started my career by converting the energy from the wind into electricity. I took the responsibility to solve the mechanical issues with 133 wind turbines at the wind farm, and their yearly preventive maintenance. Working with a task force of 42 technicians and managing their activities at sites in a structured way greatly enhanced my interpersonal skills.

In search for the next challenge, I collaborated with Zero Emission Fuels BV. ZEF BV is trying to develop a small scale plant that can convert air and sunlight into liquid fuels, essentially giving us an inexhaustible source of fulfilling our fuel needs. In one of their teams, I took on the task of developing their Electrolyzer system that converts water into hydrogen and think of creative ways to remove dissolved carbon dioxide from water. Later on, I switched teams to work towards the development of their methanol reactor too, which converts hydrogen and carbon dioxide into synthetic fuel. I designed, built a pilot reactor, and conducted experiments on it to show a 161% increase in yield and to fully characterize the reactor experimentally for different process conditions.

Outside of office, I really enjoy pencil sketching. It is something that develops patience, an eye for detail, and drive for perfection in me which I tend to carry forward with everything else that I do. Because to be good at it you need to accept the fact that no matter how well you do something, there is always a way for it to be slightly better. It is this quality that makes my sketches good and also helps me succeed professionally.

profile_positions.description:
Zero Emission Fuels BV is a company that is trying to solve the problem of dwindling fossil fuels due excessive usage. They aspire to develop a small scale plant that can convert ambient air and sunlight in to usable liquid fuel, thus giving us an inexhaustible source of fuel. I spearheaded the methanol synthesis reactor team there, which converts carbon dioxide and hydrogen into methanol. The comprehensive research required me to design, build a pilot plant and experiment on it to make it better. The reactor outperformed methanol yield by 161% and gave valuable insights for further design improvements.

Process and Instrumentation diagram | Process Flow Diagrams | ASPEN | COCO | MATLAB | Pilot testing | 3D modelling | AUTODESK FUSION 360 | Energy storage | Alternative fuels 

•	Designed the entire reactor on Autodesk fusion 360. Selected and purchased the equipments needed to build a working prototype.
•	Conducted over 35 experiments and fully characterized the methanol reactor for different pressures, temperatures, and gas compositions.
•	Devised alternative methods to acquire data without compromising accuracy and saved more than €4000 on expensive equipment.
•	Fostered coordination between research works of 5 team members working parallel to the same reactor.
•	Incorporated 2 dedicated PCBs and optimized overall control circuit to deliver the first fully automated reactor operation.
profile_positions.title: Graduate Student Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Worked in the Alkaline Electrolysis Team at ZEF BV. The task at hand was to develop a compact electrolyzer that can produce hydrogen at 55 Bar operating on solar power. The work involved a lot of product design & development, rapid prototyping, experimenting & material testing, systems & control coupled with design integration & plant scaling. Key highlights of the project were:
•	Conceptualized and demonstrated the use of a new degasser system integrated withing the electrolyzer that uses the escaping oxygen to reduce the dissolved carbon dioxide concentration in the electrolyzer medium in order to increase the longevity of the alkaline medium.
•	Fabricated the entire design of the electrolyzer using a PocketNC milling machine and assessed the utility of HDPE as a cheaper material for mass production.
•	Undertook experiments to exploit the geometry of the electrolyzer and purity of oxygen to achieve degasification and integrate it with the rest of the electrolyzer.
•	Built and tested the efficacy of a hall effect type proximity sensor to ascertain the fluid level inside the pressurized electrolyzer from outside without the need for any electrical pass-through.
•	Designed, built, and demonstrated a pass-through for fluid and gasses which can withstand the gradient of pressure from 55 Bar to atmospheric pressure
profile_positions.title: Project Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
•	Organized a 2-week study tour for 18 students from Process & Energy Department at TU Delft to Canada.
•	Negotiated Industry visits and case studies with top institutions there such as the Canadian National Laboratory, University of Toronto, McMaster University, Orgaworld, Zeton inc, etc for students to get to know their research and business network.
•	Helped manage the logistics and funding needed to carry out the tour, involving tickets, accommodation, food, conveyance, tours, etc.
profile_positions.title: Member, Study Tour Commission

profile_positions.description:
Posted as the TSM at the windfarm of Enercon India Limited (now Wind World India Limited), I assisted in the smooth operation of the windfarm for maximum power generation. The task involved solving mechanical issues and breakdowns in the wind turbines, and effective planning and execution of preventive routine operations and maintenance(ROAM) of all the 133 Wind turbines(103.2MW) under my watch.
Some key highlights of the job:
•	Monitored and diagnosed problems of all 133 WECs operational at 6 different sites to achieve a windfarm availability of 91% for the year 2015-2016.
•	Planned, facilitated, and expedited execution of yearly preventive maintenance cycle to attain 97% PM adherence. Kept track of the inventory of spare parts, and tool calibrations at sites, necessary for both preventive and breakdown maintenance.
•	Mentored and supervised a team of 42 technicians for efficient operation and fault rectification of wind turbines. Kept the site teams fully updated in terms of new technical instructions for operating procedures, and retrofittings by conducting TSS meetings.
•	Revamped documentation at sites for external audits and undertook three root cause analysis of breakdowns, which culminated in better client satisfaction.
profile_positions.title: Engineer Technical Support Mechanical(TSM)

profile_positions.description: Got exposure to various processes involved in steel manufacturing business like Metallurgical aspects of it as well as Manufacturing and processing. Studied processes like tempering, annealing and normalising of steel slabs in the plate mill. Got acquainted with the process of manufacturing railway tracks in rail mill as well as steel plates in plate mill. Finally submitted a report to the guide on Hydraulic Automated Gauge Control (HAGC) incorporated for plate mill by Danieli Automation, Italy.
